solution.text:
let us construct a triangle ABC using the given data
from the midpoint(D) of AB a line parallel to BC is drawn
Using the theorem that says if a line is drawn parallel to one side of a triangle to intersect the other two sides in distinct points, the other two sides are divided in the same ratio.
\(\Rightarrow \frac {AD}{DB}=\frac {AE}{EC}\)
it given that D is the midpoint of AB, \(\Rightarrow \frac {AD}{DB}=1\)
therefore \(\frac {AE}{EC}=1\)
hence \(_{j}_\times \frac {AE}{EC} = _{j}_\times 1=_{j}_\)

content.text:
From the midpoint of a side of a triangle ABC a line is drawn parallel to it's adjacent side,
if it intersects the third side AC at E , find the ratio, \(_{j}_\times \frac {AE}{EC}\)
